titles.title: A bill to improve the protection and management of archeological resources on federal land.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Agriculture Department, Interior Department, OMB.
Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment. With written report No. 100-569.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1033.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 12/21/1987--Introduced. Amends the Archeological Resources Protection Act to direct the Secretaries of the Interior, Agriculture, and Defense and the Chairman of the Board of the Tennessee Valley Authority to survey the archeological resources under their jurisdiction and develop documents for reporting violations of such Act.
